meanings.definition: The process of producing an image using X-rays.
meanings.sent1: Roentgenography helps doctors see inside the body.
meanings.sent2: The hospital uses roentgenography to diagnose patients.
meanings.sent3: During the roentgenography, the X-ray machine played a little tune.
meanings.sent4: Her insight was like roentgenography, revealing hidden truths.
meanings.sent5: The clarity of roentgenography is like a window into the body.

meanings.definition: The study or practice of taking X-ray images.
meanings.sent1: Learning roentgenography involves understanding X-ray technology.
meanings.sent2: Roentgenography is an important field in medicine.
meanings.sent3: The roentgenography class had a fun X-ray art project.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to roentgenography was as bright as an X-ray beam.
meanings.sent5: The precision of roentgenography is like capturing shadows on film.

meanings.definition: The technique of using X-rays to create images of the inside of an object or body.
meanings.sent1: Roentgenography reveals hidden details in objects.
meanings.sent2: The museum uses roentgenography to examine artifacts.
meanings.sent3: The roentgenography of the antique clock showed its inner workings.
meanings.sent4: Her insight into the problem was like a roentgenography of the mind.
meanings.sent5: The magic of roentgenography is like seeing through walls.
